result.execSummary:
The defendant Karlos J Whittaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Solicitation of Prostitutes, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 944.32.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bond posted  -  PAID IN FULL

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted shall be applied.    
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Bond applied; partial refund;   ds/nr   ck#16CH077308
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Aileen Henry.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld, def. placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions.  Cash bond to apply to costs due; balance to be returned to poster.  (DNA sample was ordered at the plea hearing on 6/22/16.)
Document submitted by deft.
from deft.
Sentencing hearing on October 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
With Atty Henry and ADA Phan and by approval of Judge Wagner the SEH of 9/15/16 at 1:30pm is rescheduled, as the DOC needs to appoint a new PSI writer; reset to 10/13/16 at 3:30pm.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Henry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 9/15/16 at 1:30pm.  Deft to provide proof of employment to Atty Henry.  Bond continued.
With ADA Phan and Atty Henry the PLEAH of 5/31/16 at 1:15pm is rescheduled, due to a trial proceeding in Br 6 on this date; reset to 6/22/16 at 8:45am.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney A Henry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Henry requests change of plea date.  PLEAH set for 5/31/16 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney O Uzowulu.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Uzowulu reports that Atty Henry needs to finish her investigation.  FPT continued to 5/10/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the deft would like him to withdraw and deft will then retain Atty Henry.  Deft agrees.  So ordered.  Atty J Chavez appeared; states Atty Henry wants time to obtain discovery.  FPT continued to 4/22/16 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
Atty:  A Henry.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the deft is not being accepted into veterans court, requests time to attempt to resolve case.  FPT continued to 3/10/16 at 9am.  Bond continued.

With Atty Marry, and by agreement of ADA Phan, the FPT of 1/27/16 at 8:45am is rescheduled; to allow him time meet with ADA Braun about her decision regarding veterans court; reset to 2/19/16 at 8:30am.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states they submitted an application to Veteran's court.  FPT continued to 1/27/16 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
Deft appeared and was given new date of 12/18/15 at 8:45am.
Final pre-trial at 12-18-2015 08:45 am

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty P Marry appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  ADA Phan states the deft has applied for veteran's court.  FPT continued to 12/18/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states the deft has applied for veterans court, needs to obtain residency in Kenosha.  FPT continued to 11/5/15 at 10:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry reports that he is still trying to get deft considered for veteran's court.  FPT continued to 9/23/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Marry states he would like time to apply for veterans court.  FPT continued to 8/12/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney P Marry.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  FPT continued to 7/1/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

With Atty Marry and ADA Phan the FPT of 4/9/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as he was unable to make it to the DA PTC on 3/20 and would like a chance to have a DA PTC; DA PTC set for 4/17/15 at 1:30pm and FPT reset to 5/20/15 at 8:45am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Marry. Tab pulled for Judge Wagner.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. James Allen for Atty. Phil Marry. Clerk LE. Def. has retained Atty. Phil Marry. Diane Caspari is relieved of further duty.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. Marry. Tab pulled for Judge Wagner. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. DAPT on 3-20-15 @ 1:30pm. Judicial pretrial on 4-9-15 @ 8:30am. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing
Atty Diane Caspari

115 p.m.  Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney V Karls.  Clk  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  3/5/15 @ 10 a.m.  $2500 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*No Contact w/ Super 8 Motel in Pleasant Prairie.
